stems: made one's bed and lie in it
make one's bed and lie in it
makes one's bed and lie in it
making one's bed and lie in it

dt: {bc}a piece of furniture on or in which to lie and sleep
{bc}the equipment and services needed to care for one hospitalized patient or hotel guest
{bc}a flat or level surface: such as
{bc}a plot of ground prepared for plants
{bc}the plants grown in such a plot
{bc}the bottom of a body of water
{bc}an area of sea bottom supporting a heavy growth of a particular organism
{bc}the place or material in which a block or brick is laid
{bc}the lower surface of a brick, slate, or tile
{bc}a mass or heap resembling a bed
{bc}an open, usually rectangular cargo area or platform at the rear of truck

dt.t: a pickup truck with a short {wi}bed{/wi}
We loaded the equipment and put a cover over the truck {wi}bed{/wi}.

dt: {bc}an instrumental or vocal track that is combined with other tracks to produce a musical composition

dt.t: Turner gives the track an air of familiarity with his lead vocal, which sits atop an instrumental {wi}bed{/wi} dominated by an infectious, sweeping string section.

dt: {bc}a musical soundtrack (as to a motion picture or television show)

dt.t: As a video tribute … played on a projector screen, with a music {wi}bed{/wi} complementing a montage of pictures from different stages of the players' lives, a mom admitted to having tears in her eyes.
She had {wi}gone to bed{/wi} with a man she loved and had suffered the ultimate humiliation—rejection …
caught her husband and another woman {wi}in bed{/wi} together
… he found himself {wi}in bed with{/wi} those he used to see as the wrong kind of people …
The administration had gotten {wi}into bed with{/wi} an obscure guerrilla army with which it had, in truth, few sympathies.

dros.drp: make one's bed and lie in it

dt: used to say that one is responsible for dealing with the problems that result from one's own bad decisions

dt.t: Why should taxpayers have to cover for the foolish investments and risky deals financial fat cats made? Wall Street {wi}made its bed{/wi}, the thinking goes, and now those executives should {wi}lie in it{/wi}.

et: Middle English, going back to Old English {it}bedd{/it} "sleeping place, plot of ground prepared for plants," going back to Germanic {it}*badja-{/it} (whence Old Frisian {it}bed{/it} "sleeping place," Old High German {it}betti,{/it} Old Norse {it}beðr{/it} "bolster, bedding," Gothic {it}badi{/it} "sleeping place"), of uncertain origin

Traditionally Germanic {it}*badja-{/it} has been taken as a derivative of an Indo-European verbal base {it}*b{sup}h{/sup}od{sup}h{/sup}-i-{/it} "poke, dig" (see {et_link|fossil:1|fossil:1}), on the assumption that a bed was originally a pit dug in the ground, though evidence that early Germanic or pre-Germanic peoples slept in pits seems to be lacking.
shortdef: a piece of furniture on or in which to lie and sleep

dt: {bc}to furnish with a bed or bedding {bc}settle in sleeping quarters
{bc}to put, take, or send to bed
{bc}to lay flat or in a layer
{bc}to make a bed in or of

shortdef: to find or make sleeping accommodations —usually used with down
to go to bed —usually used with down

dt: reservation along the {d_link|Niobrara|Niobrara:g} River in western Nebraska

shortdef: reservation along the Niobrara River in western Nebraska

dt: reservation in the Rocky Mountains of central Colorado

shortdef: reservation in the Rocky Mountains of central Colorado

dt: site in southern Idaho along the Snake River

shortdef: site in southern Idaho along the Snake River

dt: area of volcanic features in northern California southeast of Lower Klamath Lake

dt: {bc}a soft, airtight plastic case that is designed to be inflated and used as a bed {bc}{sx|air mattress||}

dt.t: Modern {wi}air beds{/wi} which resemble a big mattress can be very good indeed. Buy an air pump.
